meanings.definition: To seize or take possession of someone's property as security for payment of a debt or fulfillment of an obligation.
meanings.sent1: The landlord had to distrain the tenant's belongings when rent was not paid.
meanings.sent2: The sheriff distrained the car to cover the outstanding debt.
meanings.sent3: The idea of distraining the neighbor's lawnmower for borrowing sugar seemed extreme.
meanings.sent4: The bank's decision to distrain the house sent shockwaves through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The image of the officer distraining the bicycle made a lasting impression on the children.

meanings.definition: The act of distraining or seizing someone's property.
meanings.sent1: The distraining of goods was necessary to recover the owed amount.
meanings.sent2: The court ordered the distraining of the assets to settle the dispute.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a skit about the chaos caused by mistaken distraining.
meanings.sent4: In the game of Monopoly, distraining properties can turn the tide of the game.
meanings.sent5: The history lesson on distraining in medieval times was surprisingly engaging.
